fr: Mettre en œuvre les solutions aux problématiques techniques
Choisir avec discernement des architectures performantes et sécurisées
Mener à bien les différentes évolutions du SI
en: Carry out the various developments in IS

fr: Respecter les contraintes de qualité de coûts et de délais
en: Meet quality, cost and time constraints

fr: Être l’expert des infrastructures techniques de son SI
en: Be the expert on the technical infrastructure of your IS

fr: Piloter un projet d’infrastructure systèmes et réseaux
en: Lead a systems and networks infrastructure project

fr: Recueillir analyser et formaliser les besoins systèmes et réseaux de l’entreprise
en: Collect analyze and formalize the company's systems and networks needs

fr: Assurer le maintien en condition opérationnelle du réseau et de l’architecture système de l’entreprise
en: Maintain the operational condition of the company's network and system architecture

fr: Valider concevoir et mettre en œuvre les infrastructures systèmes et réseaux
en: Validate design and implement systems and networks infrastructure

fr: Communiquer et promouvoir un projet informatique
en: Communicate and promote a computer project

fr: Manager le service informatique et ses projets
Maintenir et sécuriser les infrastructures informatiques
Analyser l’adéquation logiciel matériel et SI avec les besoins de l’entreprise
en: Analyze how well software, hardware and the wider IT system fit the business needs

fr: Rédiger les besoins pour les nouveaux systèmes informatiques
en: Write requirements for new IT systems

fr: Aider à la mise en œuvre de systèmes informatiques

en: Monitor the effectiveness of IT systems

fr: Accroître la performance et la réactivité de l’entreprise
en: Increase the company's performance and responsiveness

fr: Écouter analyser et rédiger les besoins
Être garant de la pérennité et de l’évolution des solutions
en: Guarantee the sustainability and evolution of solutions

fr: Analyser et identifier tous les problèmes potentiels
en: Analyze and identify any potential problems

fr: Avoir de solides compétences pour le travail en équipe
Définir les étapes clés du cycle de vie du projet
en: Define key lifecycle milestones for the project

fr: Être en mesure de gérer une liste de problèmes ou d’améliorations
en: Be able to manage a list of issues or improvements

fr: Connecter différents appareils pour former des réseaux rapides et efficaces
en: Connect different devices together to form fast and efficient networks

fr: Installer et configurer des réseaux et des systèmes informatiques
en: Install and configure computer networks and systems

fr: Maintenir les logiciels et le matériel existants
Mettre à niveau les logiciels et le matériel obsolètes
Surveiller les réseaux et les systèmes informatiques

en: Identify how performance can be improved

fr: Travailler avec le personnel de support informatique
Fournir l’administration et le support du réseau
Rédiger et mettre à jour procédures et consignes d’exploitation / documentation
en: Write and update operating and documentation procedures and instructions

fr: Sensibiliser les utilisateurs pour optimiser leur utilisation
en: Raise awareness among users to optimize their use

fr: Conseiller la DSI sur l’utilisation des ressources du système
en: Advise the CIO on the use of system resources

fr: Se tenir informé des tendances en évolution rapide
en: Keep up to date with fast-changing trends

fr: Être en mesure de s’adapter aux différentes situations
en: Be able to adapt oneself to different situations

def: Malicious action that involves deliberately using the address of another system instead of its own.
Network of zombie PCs remotely controlled by a hacker using bots to launch mass attacks.
Exhaustive search method that tests all possible combinations to find a password or key.
Technique exploiting a vulnerability where a program does not properly verify the size of data it manipulates.
A program that allows people to receive recognition and compensation after reporting bugs, anomalies, exploits and vulnerabilities.
Cryptographic transformation of data producing a cryptogram.
Hacking tool used to decode encrypted passwords.
Parallelization of denial-of-service attacks carried out by multiple systems against a single victim system.
Attack that sends a large stream of data or packets to saturate a victim.
Attack that targets database-backed sites by passing parameters through SQL queries.
Software or hardware used by a malicious user to capture what a person is typing on the keyboard.
Malicious software that massively sends e-mail automatically without human intervention.
Fraudulent technique used by hackers to solicit sensitive personal or confidential information from Internet users.
Unsolicited electronic communication, massively sent for advertising or dishonest purposes.
An extortion form imposed by malicious code on a user of the system.
Any program or set of programs used to conceal activity, malicious or not, on a machine.
Creates a large number of processes very quickly in order to saturate the process table of the operating system.
Seemingly useful and harmless program with hidden code to collect, exploit, falsify or destroy data illegally.
Weakness in security procedures, administrative controls, internal controls, and others.
Image-like tracker on a web page that measures traffic or collects information about the user.
Program reproducing from machine to machine through network connections and information systems when it spreads.
Set of software techniques that automatically complete forms protected by a captcha.
Inspects each packet for user-defined content (e.g., an IP address) without tracking session state.
Computer crimes involving data modification to derive something of value.
Method by which the sender gives proof of sending and the recipient is assured of the sender’s identity.
Business strategy tool identifying Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats.
Forward-looking strategic plan that sets priorities and gives visibility on the organization’s ambitions.
Graphic representation of an organization's processes and their sequence.
Software model based on distributed components with discovery, access control, data mapping and security.
Cloud service model where the user accesses an application in rental mode.
Set of actions carried out by the system in interaction with actors for a purpose.
Document that defines the framing of a project: needs, objectives, constraints, features, deadlines and budget.
End of a stage or a piece of work in project management.
Ordered list(s) of operations whose total duration gives the project duration.
Ensures the project follows the schedule and that resources are well defined and used wisely.
Group that can influence or be influenced by the achievement of a company's goals.
Executives responsible for ensuring the smooth running of a project within a company.
Formal procedure to generate competing offers from suppliers/contractors.
Technique to optimize choices from an economic perspective and focus on real customer needs.
Unpredictable turn that an event can take.
Partial or complete representation of a system/object used to test and validate aspects/behavior.
Diagram representing responsibilities of each member for each task of a project.
Act by which an act in progress is amended by correcting, removing, or adding provisions.
Review with the entire team at several stages via intermediate evaluations and a final assessment.
Organization that implements practices to keep up with its ecosystem.
Network enabling delivery of products/services from raw materials to end customers.
Systematic monitoring of latest techniques and their commercial availability.
Acronym describing volatility, uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity of conditions/situations.
Set of rules for the distribution of authority, tasks, control and coordination.
Operations carried out to enable an organization to adapt to change and its environment.
